seriesStmt.title: Syriac Manuscripts in the British Library

head.note: This manuscript record does not have a summary list of contents. For composite manuscripts, the list of contents can be found under each individual part.

listRelation.desc: This composite manuscript consists of 3 distinct parts:

altIdentifier.collection: William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838
William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

head.note: This manuscript contains: Jacob of Batnae. Metrical discourses and hymns of Jacob of Batnae; Isaac of Antioch. Metrical discourses of Isaac of Antioch; An index to the contents of the volume. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 15 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Metrical discourses and hymns of Jacob of Batnae
Five discourses on the Spectacles of the Theatre
Part 1, in dodecasyllabic metre
msItem.quote: ܬܐ ܚܙܝ ܗܫܐ ܠܟܐܦܐ ܕܪܗܛܐ ܠܥܠ ܡܢ ܡ̈ܝܐ. ܘܦܚܡ ܗܢܐ ܚܙܘܐ ܕܝܠܢ ܥܡ .. ܝܐ (?). ܐܝܢܐ ܚܟܝܡ ܘܐܝܢܐ ܫܦܝܪ ܘܐܝܢܐ ܫܪܝܪ. ܕܘܢ ܒܝܕܥܬܟ ܟܕ ܠܐ ܛܪܝܫ ܒܟ ܡܣܒ ܒܐ̈ܦܐ

msItem.title: Part 2, in simple or heptasyllabic metre
msItem.rubric: ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܬܪ̈ܝܢ ܕܥܠ ܚܙܘ̈ܢܐ ܕܬܐܛܪܘܢ ܘܥܠ ܛܟ̈ܣܐ ܕܥܕܬܐ. ܒܩܠܐ ܦܫܝܛܐ. ܕܣܝܡ ܠܡܪܝ ܝܥܩܘܒ
msItem.incipit: ܠܩܥܬܐ ܕܟܪܟܐ ܫܡܥܬ. ܕܒܝܬ ܚ̈ܙܘܢܐ ܡܙܕܠܠ. ܘܒܩ̈ܘܠܣܐ ܥܙ̈ܝܙܐ. ܪܒܒܬܐ ܒܫܘ̈ܩܐ ܡܫܡܥ ܗܘܐ

msItem.title: Part 3, in simple or heptasyllabic metre
msItem.rubric: ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܬܠܬܐ ܕܥܠ ܚ̈ܙܘܢܐ ܕܬܐܛܪܘܢ ܘܥܠ ܐܪܟܝܣܛܐ
msItem.incipit: ܛܘܝ̈ܒܘܗܝ ܐܝܬܝ ܝܘܡܢ. ܝܘܠܦܢܐ ܕܢܒܣܡܟܘܢ̇ ܡܢ ܗܘ ܐܕܫܐ ܕܐܘܬܪܬܘܢ. ܐܠܐ ܛܥܝܬܘܢ ܡܢܐ ܗܘܐ.

msItem.title: Part 4, in simple or heptasyllabic metre
msItem.rubric: ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܐܪ̈ܒܥܐ ܕܥܠ ܚ̈ܙܘܢܐ ܕܬܐܛܪܘܢ ܘܥܠ ܛܟܣ̈ܝܗ̇ ܕܥܕܬܐ
msItem.incipit: ܐܟܦܝܢ ܐܢܬܘܢ ܥܠ ܫܡ̈ܘܥܐ. ܕܬܐܟܦ ܠܝ ܠܡܡܠܠܘ. ܐܘ ܫܥܬ ܠܗ̇ ܡܫܡܥܬܐ. ܘܢܫܬܘܩ ܠܗ ܐܦ ܠܫܢܐ. ܨܗ̣ܝܢ ܐܢܬܘܢ ܟܝ ܬܫܬܘܢ ܗܫܐ. ܡܢ ܚܡܪܗ̇ ܕܡܠܦܢܘܬܐ.

msItem.title: Part 5, in simple or heptasyllabic metre
msItem.rubric: ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܚܡܫܐ ܕܥܠ ܬܐܛܪܘܢ ܘܥܠ ܪ̈ܡܙܘܗܝ ܕܐܪܟܝܣܛܐ
msItem.incipit: ܥܠ ܚܙ̈ܘܐ ܣܪ̈ܝܩܐ ܐܡ̇ܪܬ. ܗܢܘ ܕܝܢ ܬܘܒ ܐܡ̇ܪ ܐܢܐ. ܠܐ ܓܝܪ ܢܟ̇ܦ ܝܘܠܦܢܐ ܠܡܓܠܝܘ ܣܝܡ̈ܬܗ.

msItem.title: On the martyrs Gūriā and Shemūnā
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܥܠ ܓܘܪܝܐ ܘܫܡܘܢܐ ܕܣܝܡ ܠܡܪܝ ܝܥܩܘܒ
msItem.note:
See Assemani, Bibl. Or., t. i.,p. 329, no. 191 ; and Cureton's Ancient Syr. Documents, p. ܨܘ
.

msItem.title: On the martyr Ḥabīb
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܥܠ ܚܒܝܒ ܣܗܕܐ ܕܣܝܡ ܠܡܪܝ ܝܥܩܘܒ
msItem.note:
See Assemani, p. 330, no. 192 ; and Cureton's Anc. Syr. Documents, p. ܦܘ
.

msItem.title: Morning and evening hymn
Discourse on the morning and the evening
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܬܫ̈ܒܚܬܐ ܕܨܦܪܐ ܘܕܪܡܫܐ ܕܝܠܗ ܕܡܪܝ ܝܥܩܘܒ
msItem.incipit: ܐܘܕܐ ܠܡܪܝܐ ܡܢ ܟܠܗ ܠܒܝ ܟܕ ܬܗ̇ܪ ܐܢܐ. ܒܓܝܓܠܐ ܕܙܒ̈ܢܐ ܕܟܕܢ ܪܡܙܐ ܕܒܪܘܝܘܬܐ.
msItem.note: The text is called in the subscription, "discourse on the morning and the evening.”

msItem.title: Morning hymn
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܬܫܒܘܚܬܐ ܕܨܦܪܐ ܕܝܠܗ ܕܡܪܝ ܝܥܩܘܒ
msItem.incipit: ܠܟ ܬܫܒܘܚܬܐ ܒܪܘܝܢ. ܕܐܢܬ ܗܘ ܡ̇ܪܐ ܢܗܝܪ̈ܐ. ܕܝܠܟ ܗܘ ܨܦܪܐ ܙܥܘܪܐ. ܐܦ ܗܘ ܨܦܪܐ ܕܠܥܠܡ.
msItem.note: This hymn is in heptasyllabic metre.

msItem.title: Metrical discourses of Isaac of Antioch
On humility
msItem.incipit: ܒܐܘܪܚܐ ܕܡ̇ܠܟܐ ܫܡ̇ܝܢܐ. ܢܪܕܘܢ ܒܗ̇ ܥܒ̈ܕܝ ܡ̇ܠܟܐ
msItem.note: See Assemani, Bibl. Or., t. i., p. 234, no. 104 .

msItem.title: On monks
msItem.rubric: ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܥܠ ܕܝܪ̈ܝܐ ܕܣܝܡ ܠܡܪܝ ܐܝܣܚܩ ܡܠܦܢܐ
msItem.incipit: ܐܠܗܐ ܕܬܩܠ ܛܘܪ̈ܐ. ܒܗ̇ܘ ܚܝܠܐ ܕܠܐ ܡܬܬܩܠ

msItem.title: An index to the contents of the volume
msItem.rubric: ܫܠܡ ܠܡܟܬܒ ܒܦܢܩܝܬܐ ܗܕܐ: ܡܐܡܪ̈ܐ ܕܐܝܬܝܗܘܢ ܗܠܝܢ: ܚܡܫܐ ܕܥܠ ܚܙ̈ܘܢܐ ܕܬܐܛܪܘܢ: ܚܕ ܕܥܠ ܓܘܪܝܐ ܘܫܡܘܢܐ: ܚܕ ܕܥܠ ܚܒܝܒ ܣܗܕܐ: ܬܘܒ ܬܫ̈ܒܚܬܐ ܕܪܡܫܐ ܘܕܨܦܪܐ: ܚܕ ܕܡܟܝܟܘܬܐ ܕܡܪܝ ܐܝܣܚܩ: ܚܕ ܕܥܠ ܐ̈ܚܐ ܛܘܪ̈ܝܐ ܕܝܠܗ ܕܡܪܝ ܐܝܣܚܩ: ܕܗܘܝܢ ܟܠܗܘܢ ܒܡܢܝܢܐ ܡܐܡܪ̈ܐ ܥܣܪ̈ܐ܀

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 9 5/8 in. by 6 ½, consisting of 48 leaves, many of which are stained by water, and some of them much torn, espeicially foll. 1—10. The quires, apparently signed with letters, were originally six in number, but the first is now lost. Each page has two columns, of from 31 to 36 lines.

item.p: Vellum, about 9 5/8 in. by 6 ½, consisting of 48 leaves, many of which are stained by water, and some of them much torn, espeicially foll. 1—10. The quires, apparently signed with letters, were originally six in number, but the first is now lost. Each page has two columns, of from 31 to 36 lines.

handDesc.handNote: The writing is a fine, regular Estrangela of the vith or viith cent.

additions.note: N.B., folio location may not be available for some items below.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue , abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

head.note: This manuscript contains: Jacob of Batnae. A discourse of Jacob of Batnae on the Raising of Lazarus; Jacob of Batnae. A sūgīthā of Jacob on the city of Edessa; Jacob of Batnae. An extract from a discourse of Jacob, without title. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 3 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: A discourse of Jacob of Batnae on the Raising of Lazarus
msItem.rubric: ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܥܠ ܠܥܙܪ ܟܕ ܢܚܡܗ ܡܪܢ. ܕܣܝܡ ܠܡܪܝ ܝܥܩܘܒ ܡܠܦܢܐ ܕܥܕܬܐ
msItem.note: See Assemani, Bibl. Or., t. i., p. 322, no. 134 .

msItem.title: A sūgīthā of Jacob on the city of Edessa
msItem.rubric: ܣܘܓܝܬܐ ܕܡܪܝ ܝܥܩܘܒ ܡܠܦܢܐ̣. ܥܠ ܐܘܪܗܝ ܟܕ ܫܠܚܬ ܠܡܪܢ ܕܢܐܬܐ ܠܗ̇.
msItem.note: See Cureton's Ancient Syriac Documents, pp. ܩܙ and 106.

msItem.title: An extract from a discourse of Jacob, without title
msItem.incipit: ܐܬܦܫܩܬ ܠܢ ܩܘܩܬܐ ܚܕܬܐ ܗ̇ܝ ܕܐܠܝܫܥ. ܕܐܝܬܝܗ̇ ܛܠܝܬܐ ܒܬܘܠܬܐ ܒܪܙܐ ܕܡܬܩܢ ܐܪܥܐ

handDesc.handNote: These leaves are written in a good, regular hand of about the viiith cent.

item.p: On fol. 55 b there is a note, stating that this manuscript was written by one Sergius

p.quote: ܐܢ̇ܐ ܣܪܓܝܣ ܚܛܝܐ ܟܬܒܬ ܡܐܡܪܐ ܗܢܐ ܟܠ ܕܩ̇ܪܐ ܒܗ ܢܨܠܐ ܥܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܟܬܒܗ ܡܛܠ ܡܪܢ.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue , abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

altIdentifier.collection: William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838
William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

head.note: This manuscript contains: Ephraim. Madrashe of Ephraim on penitence. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 item.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Mādrashē of Ephraim on penitence
msItem.rubric: ܡܕܪ̈ܫܐ ܕܡܪܝ ܐܦܪܝܡ ܕܥܠ ܬܘܬ ܢܦܫܐ
msItem.incipit: ܐܪܦܝܢ ܚܢܢ ܐܘܪܚܐ ܒܨܒܝܢ̣ܢ ܕܒܗ̇ ܪܕܝܢ ܟܐ̈ܢܐ ܠܡܠܟܘܬܐ. ܘܠܒܟܢ ܚܢܢ ܬܘ̈ܫܐ ܘܬܘ̈ܩܠܬܐ. ܘܫܒ̈ܝܠܐ ܕܡܘܒܠܝܢ ܠܐܒܕܢܐ

physDesc.p: A vellum leaf, 9 5/8 in. 6 1/2. Each page is divided into two columns, of from 30 to 35 lines.

item.p: A vellum leaf, 9 5/8 in. 6 1/2. Each page is divided into two columns, of from 30 to 35 lines.

handDesc.handNote: The writing is good, though rather inelegant, of about the viiith cent.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.catDesc: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies
Councils of the Church and Ecclesiastical Canons

langUsage.language: Syro-Arabic garshunography in East Syriac script
